Entry.1: New Years Day once more. This time in Steenwerck on the stables. Up at 6.30 morning stables at 7 finish about 7-45. Parade 9-15 – Grooming. Afternoon on at 2. Harness cleaning & preparing for move. Evening writing & study. Weather exceptional cold. Billet over Estaminet near YMCA. & mess at Sergts mess.
Entry.2: Up & about as usual. Weather much milder & thaw has set in. Collecting washing & writing at night.
Entry.3: Moving day. Up usual time & did morning stables quickly. Breakfast early. Cogged horses hoofs. Ready in good time. Moved off about 10 a.m. to Steenje. Stabled horses etc. One man with two horses missing so with Frank Huston set out to find him. In vain. Camped in an old farm building with bunks arranged in two tiers. Our stables not too bad.
Entry.4:
Morning stables as usual. On parade detailed to run line with Lieut Stanbury. Left about 10. Ran out of poles so dropped drum & went to Divn. Had dinner at Sergts Mess.

Collected mail & rations & then returned home about 5 p.m. Finished up with 23 letters which I could not read in one night.
Entry.5:
Up on stables as usual then out on the line. Completed line to Divn. by about 11.30. Returned to Outtersteen & altered line to D.A.C. Returned home. Dinner.

Evening reading remainder of letters. Billet too inconvenient for writing etc.
Entry.6:
Work at home today. Advised by Lieut Stanbury that I had been awarded Meritorious Service Medal.

Began inventory of wagon equipment. Afternoon football & writing. Evening writing in bed, not too successful. 

Met Bob Peebles. Artillery in same camp.
Entry.7: Stables etc as usual watering just before artillery. Finished wagon. Prepared to write in bed but played cards with Joe Frost.
Entry.8: Stables etc as usual. Evening solid writing in bed. Very cold.
Entry.9:
Stables as usual. Detailed to alter line laid the other day & reel up about 1 mile of it. 

Home again about 1.30 p.m. after snowing. Writing in bed at night.
Entry.10:
Work about as usual. Respirators inspected & instructed in fitting new containers.

Receive official notification of award of M.S.M. Colour received. 

Afternoon to Bailleul for a bath – no luck. Evening playing cards.
Entry.11: Dull day. Rained slightly. Grooming etc as usual. Replacing containers both morning & afternoon. Evening cards & writing.
Entry.12: Mucky day. Morning grooming & cleaning. Afternoon medical inspection etc. Evening cards & writing.
Entry.13:
Fine day. Morning grooming etc. Afternoon, ride with Joe Frost to try & see Bert Pretty or Norm Opie. Visited Berthon & Dranoutre. Evening 
writing
 cards after posting picket.
Entry.14: Morning work as usual. Report two of picket for being late. Lightly dealt with. Afternoon as usual.
Entry.15: Early morning parade as usual only cocoa was served. Weather very wet & stormy lightning. Evening writing.
Entry.16: Up as usual. Roads & ground about flooded. Grooming morning. Afternoon navigated the roads on horseback chasing up Millikent wagons. Arrived Westhof O.K. returned via Bailleul.
Entry.17: Things as usual. Floods not quite subsided. Grooming & saddle cleaning. Australian mail.
Entry.18: Trip during morning to Menis. Afternoon to saddlery. Evening writing a little.
Entry.19: Inspection of saddlery & harness. My detachment was well praised. Afternoon off on account of harness excellence. Evening writing & to a bit of a shown in marque.
Entry.20: Church parade in marque. Grooming etc afterwards. Afternoon Anzac Coves very good. Evening writing heavily.
Entry.21: Inspection of harness in wagons. Condemned wholesale & absurd remarks passed. Evening writing.
Entry.22: Morning as usual. Afternoon exercise towards Meteren. Evening writing.
Entry.23: Afternoon off to see Archies. Evening card party with Joe Hoppy . To bed late.
Entry.24: Walked in Baillieul for a bath. Afternoon cleaning saddlery & Gas inspection. Evening knocking about. Weather warm.
Entry.25: Work during morning as usual. Afternoon exercise on the new horse. Not too bad. Received parcel from home.
Entry.26: Exercise again in afternoon with Sergt Mosk. Cards evening.
Entry.27:
Work during morning. 

Afternoon rode into Bailleul to play football for D.A. sigs against DA. Harry Richards & George Leverett also came in. Chaps very good to us. Had a good game but got beaten by about 17 points. 

Had tea returned home & was advised about going forward tomorrow. Spend evening packing & arranging.
Entry.28:
Up about 8.30 am & cooked bacon which I of course burnt.

Rearranged linesmans lines including a visit to SN, BG 7 RD2. Completed the lines during afternoon.
Entry.29: Up again but managed breakfast OK. Cut wood during morning. Day quiet.
Entry.30: Cook for breakfast again. Went with Arthur Hibbert to Gunners Farm to find grave of a friend of his. Entertained him to tea. Reading.
Entry.31: Breakfast as usual. Visited Bn & checked book.
Entry.32: Up & breakfasted as usual. Visited LH, & SN. Cards evening.
Entry.33: Up and acted cook. Walked towards Plogsteert. Day uneventful.
Entry.34: Changed over of Bn in line 39 out 37 in. So good aeroplane & big gun work evidently being done today. Evening had a visit from Sergt. Coppelman 40th an old Armentieres chap. 37th Sig de La Perelle took up unoccupied bed.
Entry.35:
With Cpl Marks went to
Went to U.S. on the testing of US route. Visited Y & . Afternoon easy.

Evening took list of lines to be put through & tested tomorrow.
Entry.36: Pay here by Mr. Stanbury & Miller. 9 Lines put through or tested. Finished well before 12. Replaced D3 cables with lead finished just before tea. Evening installing H.P. exchange & fixing up Line difficulties.
Entry.37: Completed fixing up H.P. exchange. Just settling down to a rest when advice received of RD2 being . With J. Frost visited RD2 & saw that a shell 5-9 had landed right on to position of test board leaving a big shell hole. Cables knocked out.
Entry.38:
Out with Mr. Stanbury

Chapman at HP

O’Brien at SN.

Testing through to U.R. Testing through to S.N. Put thro. 9 lines. Place well blown in. Arranged for tomorrows work.
Entry.39:
Out to RD2 to test thro. Y route. Could not get Y so walked there. Finally bunched each cable & test with galvo at Y. Got no loops. So Y route is blown out. Returned to RD2 & fixed up UR, SN lot walking to U.R. Finally put thro 9 pair.

Raid on at 10 p.m. Very successful.
Entry.40:
With 4 cyclists went out to RD2 to locate fault. Found it early and going to Y for test. Go sleeves from H.P. & jointed cables identifying them later. 

Home very tired indeed receiving kind treatment from chaps here. Arranging at night to meet M. wagon at 7-15 a.m.
Entry.41: Up to meet wagon which did not come. Met Mr Stanbury with jointing material & sou westers. Went out on job after getting petrol but could not work from 4R owing to crowd. Tested thro. Y route. Returned home. Lamp defective so jointing was not done.
Entry.42: Out with Lilburn Chapman & Statton. UR people could not find place so had to direct them. Tested thro. & connected UR. Y route. Home about 2 – 3 p.m.
Entry.43:
Frost & O’Brien out to see how the joints were. O.K. 

Day in. Writing evening.
Entry.44:
Joe & O’Brien fixed joints after difficulty owing to blackness of flame of lamp. Visited E.F. for a bath going by the little train & returning via motor wagon. 

Evening writing.
Entry.45: Fine day. Visited PM to check line book. Study at night.
Entry.46: Fine Day. Morning visited LH & BG etc. Visited Y in afternoon and saw shooting. Had look around Bn H.Q.
Entry.47: Easy morning blowing about. Visited by Mr. Stan. Fountain. Afternoon carried drum lead cable to Y. & ran cables from board to SE36. Tiring work.
Entry.48: Out with W. Miller on at BN. Up at 6 am to meet wagon at 7 am. Turned up 8.20. Put in 20 cables into BN joined up outside & put in 20 cables out. Good days work.
Entry.49: Out at 10 am jointing cables at breastworks. Progress slow so took Joe out in afternoon. Finished in good time.
Entry.50:
Pay at 10 am G. W. Stanbury.

Visited joint GR & bury. Returned via BN & fixed up re gas doors being done by Spr Worthington. 

Afternoon out to joint in paddock. Obtained pump but finally fished out cable and jointed.

Fine day. Evening bit crook & had Alex Lilburn down for an occasion.
Entry.51: Joe out in morning. O’Brien Chapman to fill in holes. Afternoon putting in supports. Gloucester House
Entry.52: Out at 10 a.m. jointing 7 pm. cables near G.R. & fixing up cables in G.R. Home by 2.30 & cooked tea. Harry Chadwick Joe Worthington in for tea, Harry stopping here.
Entry.53: Jointed cables past G.R. & progressed with installing the board at G.R.
Entry.54: Put BN route on the board at G.R. Finished off joints. Home about 1.30. Afternoon easy.
Entry.55: Joe to BN to test lines OK. Bath afternoon. Things easier
Entry.56: To RD2 with Lilburn identifying extra lines Sn – RD2 then to RD, spoke over line to H.P. Good walk around. Home afternoon.
Entry.57:
Mr. Stanbury & Fountain up. Visited SN. BN Chateau & G.R. returned with wood by myself. 

Afternoon out with Joe & to test to L.S. but joints not finished. Tested to hole.
Entry.58:
Out to UL to clear 
the
 trouble & found 
all
 42 straps shorting. Renewed straps. Returned about 2.30 p.m. Evening very busy on phone.
Entry.59: Out to test LS – GR. very disappointing only 22 pairs obtained. Cold day with snow. Busy again on phone.
Entry.60:
Up to get Brown phone from W/T. Chaddy out & found that some 
BN
 LS route on BN board.

Joe & Oly stripped at BN.
Entry.61: Out to fix up GR – LS but found trouble owing to BN & LS ranks becoming mixed. Finally made some order & put BN on boards also part of LS. Home late. Joe finished stripping at BN. Harry commenced SN.
Entry.62: Out early & finally cleared up GR – LS after much working out etc. Finished late. Joe installed boards at BN. Harry progressed well at SN. Everything looking all right. O’Brien – Mitchell go to Corps. Evening cards.
Entry.63:
Steve up to pay and we went out to BN. SN & HU. Harry & Joe finished HU & SN. I 
put
 tested GR – BN route and put on BN board. Harry tested SN.
Entry.64: Finished BN off & Harry finished marking route by 11 am. Packed up for return & finally moved off in G.S. arriving Ravelsberg about 6 pm. Tea there, finally bunked on floor.
Entry.65: Up early & awaited detachment from Tahuna. Received mount & moved off via. Baillieul to Arques. Parked wagons in square & picketed horses behind. Tea with Hoppy & Andy in Estaminet. Turned in with Hoppy on floor.
Entry.66: Left Arques about 9.30 & proceeded via Setques Lumbres to Nielles-‘lez-Blequin & then to Vaudrighem . Stabled in old farm house. Chancellor & I billeted in officers billet at same place as Sergts billet. Extremely nice.
Entry.67: Up too late for stables. Hasty breakfast and on parade just in time. Summer time adopted. Groomed horse. Afternoon football & bath. Evening talking etc. Jimmy Letcher Harry Chadwick promoted Sergts.
Entry.68:
Called for first parade and on a bit late. 

Out at 9.30 to lay a line to 11th Bde. Velinghem. Beautiful day so had a great job but cable ran out about 2 miles from end. Got home about 6.30 after a very pleasant days hard work. Evening disappeared before I knew I was home.
Entry.69: Out again to finish line and arrived out on job about 11 am. Finished about 1.30 pm. Home in good time. Excellent day. Writing night.
Entry.70: Joe went on leave so escorted him to Lumbres. Off OK about 1.30. Had dinner, made some purchases & returned home about 4 p.m. Football after tea. Evening went quickly.
Entry.71: On to saddlery solid and cleaned up saddles. Raining early but dull all day.
Entry.72: Fine again. Buzzed about on odd jobs & stacked wagon afternoon. Evening prepared for tomorrow.
Entry.73:
Moved off to Nielles for Boulogne but was advised that I was not to go to B. but was due for Blighty tomorrow. 

Returned to Vaudringhem & arranged things but on returning to Nielles was advised that I would not go until day after tomorrow.

Writing evening Jack King in Boulogne.
Entry.74: Up on work as usual for morning. To Nielles in afternoon and after much waiting completed everything. Evening writing & final.
Entry.75: Left Vaudringhem on horseback with Chanc about 10.45 but at Nielles lez Blequin Page changed with Chanc. Arrived Lumbres good time had egg dinner & caught 1 pm train for St Omar with W/T chap. Trip very slow & delays long. At Arques changed on to ROD train which was passing us. Arrived just too late for leave train so caught another ROD train for Calais. Fairly fast trip this time, long walk to rest camp. Had tea, drew blankets etc and got to bed fairly late. Trip up extremely slow.
Entry.76:
Up at 6.30, breakfast immediately. Fell in about 9-30 & though my pass was not marked for the early boat I schemed through where I should have waited. Marched to boat with many productions of passes & packed below. Went up on deck just before leaving. Fine weather.

Left Calais about 11 am & arrived Dover about 11.15 (Clock 1 hr different). Managed to scramble into first train & arrived London about 2.40 p.m. 20 Horseferry Rd & fixed up bath, change etc.

Met Norm. Richardson. Rang Will up & arranged to meet for tea. Got paid etc. Had tea with Will went to Chu Chin Chow. Good seats great show. Stopped with Will at a neighbouring soldiers home.
Entry.77:
Visited hairdressers, visited bank & looked around in morning. Visited Opera Marriage of Figaro. Very good. Had company of elderly Capt. Very good. 

Met Will had tea & then to the Better ‘Ole. Met Roy Ewart & Nick there. Show not too bad. Slept at Horseferry Rd.

Arranged to go to Scotland with Will tomorrow night.
Entry.78:
Morning at Grafton Galleries War Pictures. Extremely good & interesting. After Hyde Pk. Met another chap & spend afternoon interestingly. Instead of meeting 
Bert
 Will only met Bert also on leave. All off to Scotland.

Got new tunic – fixed colours had tea, visited Ciro’s. Then off to Kings Cross being warned of an air raid on the way.

Got good seats, left for Edinburgh about 10.30. Pretty crook with biliousness. Met mate of Les & Will in carriage.
Entry.79:
Passed thro York & Newcastle & had a decent sleep as time went on. 

Arrived Edinburgh about 8.30 am. Introduced to Cockburn Hotel by the cobber of . Took up position at the Hotel. Very nice. At breakfast met Korah. Afterwards along Princes St, then to Holyrood (closed) so visited Castle.

Afternoon could not get accommodation to go to Forth Bdge so had photos taken. Visited Portobella. Not much impressed. Walked along beach.

Evening on walk & to . Very enjoyable.
Entry.80:
To Holyrood. Good look round & interesting yarns. 

Afternoon no bus available for Forth Bridge so took taxi. Then to HMAS Australia by launch. Met Frank Rogerson’s brother who showed us about. Home by about 6.30 by bus.

Evening visited Gardens & strolled about.
Entry.81:
To Church in morning out West End way. Disappointed with singing. Coming home met some young ladies.

Afternoon showed around Braid Hills & Evening walked out towards Zoo. Very enjoyable once again.
Entry.82:
Astir early & caught train to Glasgow. 

Walked about until struck Overseas Club. Book beds etc. Visited North Engine Works. Saw 6", 8" shells, aeroplane engines being machined. Afternoon walked about again & finally finished up by having a swim. 

Evening to Opera. Carl Rosa Coy. Madame Butterfly. Not too bad.
Entry.83:
Up early for 8.40 train to Balloch then boat up to Loch Lomond calling at various little villages until Inversnaid. A couple of hours to spare so climbed hills instead of having dinner. Great fine views. Good trip but slightly cold. Met Australian Civilian whose views of us were interesting. 

Home by about 6 p.m. & after much coaxing etc. visited Whist Drive & Dance at Blackfriars Church. Fine gathering. Won the Drive; Prize fountain pen. Thanked people.
Entry.84:
Around streets in morning. Wharves shops etc. Afternoon to . Saw nose caps being made 15" shells being machined. Practically all girl workers even in 15" room. 

Evening met last nights friends & landed in pictures. Home early & a good bye.
Entry.85:
Up early – caught 7 am train to Aberdeen via Sterling, Perth. Saw Wallace Monument. Arrived about 12-30.

Fixed up at Hotel & then to Beach & Don Bridge. (Photo taken & spend a pleasant ½ hour there)

Evening along 
Princes
 Union St & visited Beach again.
Entry.86:
Shop mostly open. Very surprised. Raining. 

Visited Dee Bridge, then the Docks. After dinner took the longest tram ride out past Deeside. On return ascertained photos O.K. Arranged evening & Had good time.

Leave going splendidly.
Entry.87:
Away early via Dundee Tay & Forth Bridges to Edinburgh. 
Enjoyable
 trip. Found Will at the Hotel. Very wet. Afternoon in rain to Nelson Monument. Met friends at 6 p.m. Visited Royal. Another good day though weather bad.
Entry.88:
To Central Hall. Meth. Church. Anniversary service but not much different from the ordinary. 

Met Frank Rogerson. Had great sing. 

Afternoon visited Braid Hills again. Very misty.

Evening strolled about & finally turned up at Station in time for 10 p.m. train. Left Will who could not travel until tomorrow. Farewelled Edinburgh people in Sure Scotch style. 

Frank Rogerson in same carriage. Good sleep.
Entry.89:
After comfortable trip arrived London about 8.20 a.m. Had breakfast, obtained seats for Opera. Finished morning at tailors getting tunic altered.

Afternoon with Bert to Hampstead Heath where the Cockneys had their Easter Monday ‘alf ‘oliday. Very funny & peculiar. Weather wet &amp. many of the holiday makers returned early. 

Tea at Central Hall, Then to Opera Aida. Simply glorious. Absolutely the best I have ever heard. 

Home late.
Entry.90:
Up at 6 a.m. breakfasted & off for Victoria Stn. 

Caught train for Dover. Marched to House billet, had dinner, marched to boat & across to Calais. Marched to various camps until finally lodged. 

Had tea late. Turned in early.
Entry.91:
Up at 6 am with nothing to do. 

Met Korah who has been hung up here. Had bath, & strolled about camp. Changed to tents. Afternoon parade & on fatigue to docks. Had good look around. 

Evening walk about Calais shopping.
Entry.92: Up at 7 a.m. and put in morning reading writing. Met Sandy in afternoon & out in evening. Met couple Waacs & walked about the town.
Entry.93:
Up at 7 am with warning of leaving early. 

Schemed out to writing room with blankets & wrote more. 

Afternoon pictures at Y.M. Evening out about Calais shopping.
Entry.94:
Parade 7.45 & marched off to Camp. Issued dinner & tea tickets.

Marched Fontinettes Station drew dinner & tea after great push boarded train thro. window. Left about 12 & went via Boulogne Abbeville to Canaples. 6.30 p.m. Marched in rain to Corps H.Q. well lost & stop in duty stable wet through.
Entry.95:
Could not slept owing to the cold. Someone built fire & so we warmed at it & then went away for a few minutes sleep. Managed during whole of night about an hour.

Up at daylight and dug up Corp H.Q. Met Joe Smith, obtained location of Divn. & marched off immediately. Had couple eggs in a village.

Arrived Divn. about 8.30 am. Received mail gear etc etc. & carried on with work. Boys have been very busy. Walk with Hoppy. Good sleep.
Entry.96:
Up at first parade back to the usual thing.

Horse lines very muddy. Heard experiences of chaps during retreat. Papers not quite accurate. Wagons been very busy.

Writing evening.
Entry.97: About stables as of old Mustard now used as a draught. Evening writing solid.
Entry.98:
Still on stables. Plenty of cable work doing on other detachments.

Evening a little writing & good sing song.
Entry.99: Finer than in the past few days. On stales as usual. Finished mail.
Entry.100: Very fine day. Stables. Good game football evening.
Entry.101:
Out with wagon to Lahausye?, laid 2 twins to wood mile away. Home by 12.30 p.m. 

Evening cards. Handed in 1 blanket. Cold sleep.
Entry.102:
Slightly off colour. Afternoon exercise. Raced twice. Won twice. 

Evening to bed early. Very cold.
Entry.103: Somewhat cold. Nothing much doing. Chanc Corporal. Exercise afternoon. Remained homes. Evening little writing. Bed early.
Entry.104: Dull day. All horses out in afternoon to usual place near Frechencourt. Evening game football. Evening writing & study.
Entry.105: Out staying 7 pair cable to Quineau. Finished about 3.30 pm. Afternoon raining. Evening little writing.
Entry.106:
Very cold & wintery. Knocking about as usual. Sing song tonight but crowd not as large as usual.

Mail (10) 17/2/ arrived.
Entry.107: Cold again nothing special. Evening writing & study.
Entry.108: Fine morning sunny & warm. Midday raining. Evening writing.
Entry.109: Fair day. Afternoon off – taking things easy. Writing again.
Entry.110:
Eight Hours Day. Fine. Afternoon football match. Officers NCO V Men. Men won easily. 

Bath evening. Photos arrived from Aberdeen. Very good. Finished mail.
Entry.111: Fine day. Things as usual. Cards evening. Also packed photos. Fine evening plenty bombing.
Entry.112: Shelling close early in morning. Heavy barrage heard about 3.30 – 5.30 a.m. Fair day. Things as usual. Attack attempted. Result unknown. Writing evening.
Entry.113: Weather good. Nothing doing. Evening writing & talking until late.
Entry.114: Weather good. Things much as usual. Afternoon walked for boot-polish. Evening cards & writing.
Entry.115: Fine day but nothing doing. Evening a little writing.
Entry.116: Out on limber to Franvellers, Heily , Pont Noyelles & Quierrieu. Home late about 2 p.m. Afternoon off. Evening writing.
Entry.117: Carried on in usual manner. Evening writing etc.
Entry.118: Things as usual only too wet for grooming. Afternoon spent in billet. Evening playing auction bridge.
Entry.119: Dull & cold but work as usual. Paid 60 fr. Study.
Entry.120: Things much as usual only a marked improvement in weather. Out along Quierrieu Rd grazing horses. Very pleasant. Writing again.
Entry.121: To baths at Quierrieu in morning. Fine bath & ride most of the way home. Afternoon easy. Evening swim near Frechencourt with Joe Frost. After that bath.
Entry.122: Wagon out – weather fine. With own sappers & Driver Duggan unusual to Lahoussye reeled up about 2 ½ miles cable. Evening writing again. Met (O.W.) Rowlands & saw Lieut Stafford at .
Entry.123: Rain during night. Drizzle practically all day. Afternoon cards bridge. Evening solid writing.
Entry.124: Dull day – out with Drvr. Duggan with limber. To Frechincourt Behencourt & Franvellers. Back about 1.30.
Entry.125: Wet – No parade at 9-15. Played cards. Afternoon better.
Entry.126: Finer but during grazing had shower of rain during which some horses returned to stables. Relieved of Roster of limbers.
Entry.127:
Lovely day. Grooming morning solid job. Afternoon tackled saddlery. Evening 
at ease
 reading & writing.
Entry.128: Move on tomorrow. Things very easy. Met Bill Taylor of 2nd Div Sigs who took over. Also George Young. Both fine. Packed up & advised arranged for work tomorrow.
Entry.129:
Up as usual packed up and luggage dumped. 

Out at 8-30 to Lahoussye with wagon to reel up two spare lines to Behrencourt – Pont Noyelles Road. Had dinner. Picked up drum cable at 2nd Div. 

Arrived home 3 p.m. at Allonville. Evening to Pierrots with Hoppy. Really enjoyable. Salved good book of Aussie. 

Mod off evening hay.
Entry.130:
Up & cleaned for presentation decoration parade. 8.30 fell in & finally in order on Aerodrome ground. 

General Birdwood 
arranged
 arrived & church parade started. Medals presented & then ribbons. March past & rain hurried end. Afternoon at ease. 

Evening Mod bad. Had to keep her on move as she could not keep still. Vets paid 2 visits. Getting worse. Finally shot about 10 p.m. after tiring evening.
Entry.131:
Buried Mod in morning. Not too pleasant job.

Afternoon writing & witnessed football match V Corps. Wet on & off all day.
Entry.132:
Instructed to move out with composite detachment to be attached to D.A. Drivers Hopkins etc. & my own sappers etc.

Fixed re pay etc. Moved off with No. 1 wagon to Longpre arriving 4.30. Parked wagon & spent evening cleaning up.
Entry.133:
Up early & on road for Epagne 
early
. 8 a.m. Very fine day so trek pleasant. Arrived about 5 p.m. Parked & fixed up all right in a chateau grounds.
Entry.134: Up at 6.30 parade 7 a.m. Watered, blundered about re billeting. Obtained private mess jumped afterwards. Swim in Somme very good. Very fine day.
Entry.135:
Conducted parade 7 a.m. Grooming etc.

Off to Abbeville in afternoon with Whytecross & Robinson by motor wagon. Stopped but got through on a yarn.

Knocked about the town but afterwards called on Miss Priestman. Had tea very tediously. Left about 7.45 after further knocking about the streets. Very hot.
Entry.136: Fine day again. Things as usual. Horses looking well. Swim in afternoon. Harness improving. Weather holding well. Writing evening.
Entry.137: Easy today – with usual swim in afternoon. Hot.
Entry.138: Things easy weather fine. King, Whytecross & Robinson on job Pont Remy. Afternoon swim.
Entry.139:
Morning grazing and things as usual. 

King, Hopkins Whytecross & Robinson on job. Pont Remy. Swim in evening. Hot day. 

Big air raid.
Entry.140:
Things as usual but a
 Up on racecourse to try Grey with Sapper Dodd up. I was on Hopkins Darky which cast a shoe. Milly too strong for Dodd. Had Darky reshod. 

After to Races (8th Bde) & watched couple of races & met Jimmy Force. O.W.C. Then 4 p.m. to Abbeville & knocked about enjoyably.

Hot but thunderstorm about 6 p.m. Very heavy rain for ½ hr.
Entry.141:
Harness inspected on horses by Cpt Ferguson. Very satisfactory. 

After run with Milly on racecourse. Things fair. Afternoon writing. Overcast day.
Entry.142: Day wet. Nothing much doing. Anticipating races.
Entry.143: Inspection of harness horses wagons by Capt Joycey. Everything good oh! Had interesting talk to Capt. Obtained clippers. Line to Racecourse Run by L/Cp King. Visited Abbeville with Vince Healy afternoon, evening.
Entry.144:
Grazing along canal bank morning. 

Afternoon races on flat up the hill. Very successful day. Arrangements good. Bookies in great form. Waacs nurses brass hats in good numbers. Had Millie in. Ran 6th. No luck.

Evening reading.
Entry.145: Cool day. Had D.A horses up in our stables. Visited Pont Remy afternoon. Writing evening.
Entry.146: Morning uneventful. Afternoon had ride along canal bank with McTier finally finishing in Abbeville. Nice afternoon. Home in time for watering.
Entry.147:
Trip int
 Arranged shoeing of horses with 31st Btn. Into Abbeville on my own later. Home uneventfully early.
Entry.148:
Things much the same. Kit Inspection. Cleaning up etc. for move tomorrow. 

"Snowy" lame on first watering parade & Farrier & vets puzzled. Shoe removed no trouble apparent. Reshod last thing.
Entry.149: Up a trifle earlier than usual & moved off for Epagne about 10 am for Hangest by a very circuitous route. Snowy led. Arrived about 3 p.m. without dinner. Fixed up things. Strolled the village.
Entry.150:
Up about 5.30 and moved about about 8.30 from Hangest sur Somme. 

Arrived Longpres – or Amiens about 1.30 pm. Did not ride Snowy. Camped there for the night in the old position. 

Inspection Respirators. Field Dressings & Steel Helmets 7 pm.
Entry.151:
Up about 6.30 a.m. Watered up etc. & moved off from Longpre about 10.30 passing thro. Amiens arrived Glisy. Returned to Coy. Horse lines behind hill in wood. Had dinner then fixed things up.

Fixed tent in evening. Swim in lagoon.
Entry.152:
Parades as per old regime Rev. 6.30 7 a.m. first parade. 

Had rivetting put up behind horses. Arranged stores rations etc.

Evening completed shakedown rather well.
Entry.153:
Things commenced as usual. 

Just on feeding up evening large shell (9" – 11") landed near lines. Sid Monks mare killed, another horse wounded destroyed later. Alf House severely wounded losing his chin. Brooksby arm cut off. Dad Harris arm hit. All off to CC.S.

Cleared horses away to different place and about 7 p.m. moved to new lines toward Camon. Fixed tent, transferred gear etc. Bed very late.
Entry.154: In new camp in hollow. Fixed things up & carried on as usual. Managed a little writing in evening.
Entry.155: Things the same. Swim in evening.
Entry.156:
Day passed with the ordinary grooming cleaning etc. Cricket match watched in evening. No. 4 Section beat HQ etc by 16 runs.

Saturday 8 June

Things same as ever. Routine 
Grooming
 

Rev. 6 a.m. First 6.30 Water, grooming feed. 2nd 7.30 9-15 – 12 Grooming Harness etc.
Entry.157:
2 p.m. – 4.30 p.m. Grooming Harness 

Evening writing solid.
Entry.158: Grooming etc, grazing in morning. Afternoon off. Watched cricket V. 27 Btn. Won easily. Evening completed mail.
Entry.159: Light rain during morning. Afternoon in charge grazing up on rise. Evening cards with Hoppy Joe Frost & Andy.
Entry.160:
Fine day with things as usual. Fresher after yesterday. After ride on Snow to Blangy Tronville to see Norm Opie. Doing well – Had pleasant hour or so.

After tea had swim writing to later.
Entry.161:
Rifle inspection caused some angered remarks of Lt. . Daily inspns. threatened. 

Paid in morning. Otherwise day uneventful.
Entry.162:
Rifle inspection by Capt Buckland. Satisfactory. 

With Spr Hewett told off to go to Corps. Field Punishment Compound near . Went there with good ride picked up Dr. Huston & escorted him back to Orderly Room. Very pleasant ride. Xmas book fixed in pay book.
Entry.163: Muggy, tiring day. Felt like the weather most of the day. Did a bit of study at night.
Entry.164:
Things just the same. 

Cricket in evening against 7th Art. On picket – falling in at 6 am & feeding up at 8.15. Slept in picket tent.
Entry.165:
In bed for the first parade. 

Horses loose all the morning. Some broke away but were finally caught. 

Cricket afternoon. I was an umpire. We beat 27 Btn. by 21 runs. 

Writing evening.
Entry.166:
Things as usual grooming morning, grazing afternoon. 

Evening on picket for loosing horse inside the lines. Evening completed mail. Study.
Entry.167:
Morning up around Q.M. fixing matters up.

Afternoon knocked on the head with a stone & a cut was the result. Evening easy – French aeroplane landed close by engine trouble.
Entry.168:
Rainy so not much grooming. Head dressed. Hoppy reverted Sapper & posted 10th Bde kite suite. 

Heavy rain dinner time 
swamped
 wet lower end of tent. Afternoon writing. Evening improved tent with covers from Richy.
Entry.169: Things much as usual. Grazing horses afternoon. Evening easy.
Entry.170:
Off after dinner to day to obtain oatmeal etc. with Dr. Nelson to Camon, through Amiens to Salieux to EFC Canteen. Good ride & great view of Amiens. Fairly knocked about but still looking well.

Evening picket.
Entry.171: As usual. Game of tennis evening.
Entry.172:
Morning much as usual. Cricket match against Pioneers in 
evening
 afternoon. P. 78 Us 137 Vince Healy 54. Acted as scorer. Mail arrived.
Entry.173: Grooming etc in morning. Afternoon grazing on paddock past the dump. Evening visit from Hoppy.
Entry.174: Things easy. Afternoon around the village. Evening to La Motte to see show but it was off. Returned home & yarned the evening away.
Entry.175: Things much the same. Evening wrote heavily & saw Major later on.
Entry.176: Fine. Alarm call out threatened & everything in readiness for rapid move. Concert on field other side of the Rly.
Entry.177: Fine again. Detailed to remain behind with the B detachment on D.A. Buzzed about with preparations. Picket at night.
Entry.178:
Up at 5.30 am. & plenty of work doing. 

Finally stables moved out to Cosy but with B. Det. stopped behind with D.A. Moved horses to cookhouse site and set up camp thereabouts. Fodder ration small. 

Arranged camp all day. Living separate from the others, cookhouse of our own.

All very good.
Entry.179:
Stable routine much the same as usual. Marching order parade 9-15. Swim afternoon. 

Evening engaged on fodder matter. 4 days ration 260 lbs oats & 1 bale of hay (11 horses). Report submitted. 

Home very late amid air raid.
Entry.180: Wagon out (Dr. Huston) but returned with broken wheel. Stables much as usual, free & easy. Swim in afternoon.
Entry.181:
Wagon to La Motte for a new wheel. Bungled up & no wheel drawn. 

Afternoon Moroney & Whytecross up to lay our line. Very warm. Swim in afternoon. Bombed fish in Somme. Got one, one stolen on us.
Entry.182:
Fine again. 

Moroney moved up to O.P. McTier
Entry.183:
Bde visual Stradling 
McTier
 Whytecross local lines.

Afternoon bombed for fish – No luck.
Entry.184:
Heavy barrage in morning and attack made by Austn. Divs. 1 ½ miles advance on 4 mile front 1,500 prisoners. Very satisfactory.

Whytecross relieved. Moroney forward. assistance of horses refused. 

Wrote a little.
Entry.185: Parade 9-15 (Sergt Healy Grazing afternoon. Evening knocking about.
Entry.187:
Birthday. 

Hot day. Regaled the boys on Cider on the occasion. Swim afternoon.
Entry.188: Thunderstorms today. Biddy gave birth 4 pups all 5 drowned. Work as usual. 7th Bde show evening. Good Yarns told during the waiting by infantry chaps. Home in great spirits.
Entry.189:
Wet 
day
 at times. Plenty of work about camp. Grazing prevented by rain. Evening writing.
Entry.190:
Capt. Ferguson on 
first
 parade and harness inspection promised for Saturday. Afternoon cleaning saddlery. Evening knocking about.
Entry.191:
"Rogerson" No. 100 missing first thing. Scoured countryside unsuccessfully. Report Capt who attended 9-15 parade. Picket to be instituted. Matter reported. 

Cleaning saddlery afternoon. Writing evening.
Entry.192: Harness Insp. O.K. After ride after missing horse. Unsuccessful. Evening writing etc.
Entry.193:
Unsuccessful search of horse continued. Move tomorrow. 

Limber out all day. Home late but manure removed & wagon washed immediately. during the day. Arranged move tomorrow.
Entry.194:
Up at good time. Camp dismantled & packed. Limber returned by D.A. (went forward early) 9 a.m. packed also.

Swim after hot work of cleaning up. Light lunch about 11-15 finished & moved off from Glisy about 12.10 p.m. Arrived Buzzy 1-15 p.m. Arranged stables etc. 

With the Coy again.
Entry.195: Raining heavily early. Ordinary grooming etc. Evening picket. Day finer.
Entry.196:
Slept in (picket last night). Stables as usual. 

Difficulty about tents. Finally had to hand in 2 bell tents & 2 covers. Acquired huge artillery cover and put up lean to. Had 6 chaps extra on a/c of rain.
Entry.197: Stables as usual. Intermittent raining. Out on horseback to look for lost horse. No luck. Writing evening.
Entry.198: Work as usual. Afternoon grazing on other side of the stream. Evening feeling off.
Entry.199: Slept in first parade. Felt a bit better but later rather crook. Visited AMO & had dose of oil. Laying about most of the day.
Entry.200:
Fine day 
but
 Horse out in the paddocks all day. Cricket in afternoon. Teams picked up. Made 0 & 12. 

Evening picket. Reading.
Entry.201: Fine day. Horses out again all day. Saddlery cleaning. Writing evening.
Entry.202: Damp in morning so horses in. Things as usual. Yanks attached to Coy for training. Pretty busy about the place.
Entry.203: Good day. Things much the same. Horses out, rode with them both out & in. With the tent full to Cooees. Great evening. On picket later.
Entry.204:
Fine day out with horses. 

Whytecross off – horse missing until late in afternoon. Out to 9th Field Amb. making alterations to phone. 

Home late – but played cricket after tea.
Entry.205:
Fair day, couple of showers.

Horses out again but in driving out got thrown clean over the horses head. No damage done. Rode in with them evening.

Later to Cooees. Extremely good. Had Cooee visitor to tent after show. Good.
Entry.206: Wet day. Horses did not go out. Ordinary.
Entry.207:
Wet in morning. 

Afternoon cricket V Cooees. Umpired. Won by a few runs. Very pleasant match.

Evening practising cricket & picket.
Entry.208:
Fair. Obtained piano from mess in morning installed in our tent. Horses out later. Singsong at dinner time.

To Cooees at night but hall full by the crowd rushing it. Played cricket & then another sing song under the cover stretched out.
Entry.209: Fine day, horses out so things easy in consequence. Cricket match against 3rd B.A.C. Made a good duck. Read & singsong finally.
Entry.210: Day as usual. On picket. Great sing song at night again.
Entry.211: Things much the same. Finished off with the singsong at night.
Entry.212:
Wet day. 
Nothing much doing

To dentist & had old stump extracted & filling of another commenced. Pretty rough time afterwards though actual work good. Afterwards all right.
Entry.213:
Slightly wet. Grooming etc. as of old. 

Good show at Cooees. Enjoyable. Good singsong afterwards until all hours.
Entry.214:
Dull day but fine. Things just ordinary. Peaceful resting afternoon.

Good singsong again with many chaps assisting. Everybody sung to a standstill.
Entry.215: Dull in morning. Afternoon Glisy for a ride. Caught in rain returning but called in at a camp to shelter.
Entry.216:
Wet day – not too auspicious for the big stunt to come off shortly. Preparations marvellous & fast. Quiet evening, but singsong later. 

In bed called out to go to Chateau to maintain line to 11th Bde. (already disc). Left out 11 p.m. arrived 12-30. Road blocked with great traffic including tanks.
Entry.217:
Found 2 lineman out on line on arrival so turned in about 1 a.m. Up at 8 am. breakfasted etc. Afternoon out on line. Removed faults. Saw Norm Opie & George Suckling. 

Plenty of tanks about. Preparations evidently completed, everybody waiting to jump. Detailed to H.A. with Lovekin. Packed and marched to H.A. in record time. (Maintaining armoured cable). Got a cramped position in a little hole & managed a little sleep.
Entry.218:
Up at 4 a.m. and awaited the stunt. At 4-20 up she went & noise was terrific. Everything went well. Lines held. Artillery chased up infantry very quickly. Day foggy.

Out in morning around about. Plenty of prisoners. Casualities very slight. News better as day goes on. Out in afternoon looking about.
Entry.219:
Fine day – mist slightly. 

11th Bde giving trouble. Finally put in a pole crossing instead of a bury & after trouble about the pair used had line working again.
Entry.220:
Fine day.

11th Bde line still crook. After much investigating & annoyance ran D3 piece from pole crossing to Bde. OK. 

Evening just on dark 23rd M.G. out. Nosing about until late but found M.G. moved up. Field Engrs & Pioneers took the line. 

To bed late.
Entry.221:
Fine day. Down to Vare for water in morning. Had a swim at the same time. 

Then 
to
 10th Bde line out 3.30. Walked & walked for miles past 10th Bde old position. Line under traffic everywhere. Finally got line thro. returned home dead beat 10.30 p.m. Must have walked about 13 miles.
Entry.222:
Fine day.

Busy in office in morning then line to 10th Bde out again. Long tramp to big valley, found ¾ miles cut out. Reeled up line round a big bend, took a short cut and restored the break. Wrong lines jointed – so swapped over.

Home about 5 p.m. Had dinner after bit of trouble. Fixed up lines, attended to office business until late.

Moving out tomorrow.

Evening roads full of transport.
Entry.223:
Up at 2 a.m. but lines fixed up. 

Up at 7 am with 10th Bde out but did not go on it. Had breakfast & packed up, tramped to H.M. Picked up finally by box car to Bussy. 

Afternoon swim. Evening at ease. Mail.
Entry.224: Up on morning stables as of old. Morning fixed cable wagons etc. Afternoon fixed wagon swim and reading. Evening cricket.
Entry.225: Day spent in grooming & fixing things up. Evening played cricket but did badly again.
Entry.226: Out with wagon reeling up cable. Got 4 drums in morning & 2 in afternoon. Evening writing & football.
Entry.227: Morning did some washing. Horses out in paddock. Writing at dinner time. Scrubbed saddlery in afternoon.
Entry.228: Fine day easy mornings grooming. Afternoon erected the tent in the old position on frame work. To Daours for sandbags. Knocking about in evening.
Entry.229: Evening as usual & completed saddle. Move tomorrow arrangements made.
Entry.230: After busied demolition of camp we moved off from Buzzy and arrived via Daours, Corbie Vaux near Sailly-le Sec. Fixed horse lines close to side of the main road. Had swim. Retire under the old cover. Road busy with tanks etc.
Entry.231:
At the usual stable routine. 

Cable wagon out 11th Bde to a DS Sailly-les-Sec to Sailly Lauerete . Extremely hot. Finished line in good time. Swim. Out again over line. Washed Snowy on return.

Great stock of fruit in.
Entry.232:
Began ordinary routine but out on job to Div. with Pip Page & others. Running 14 cable along water pipe trench. Extremely hot again. 
Mail
 Souveniring poles. Dug up 50 yds of trench. 

Mail in later. Great swim with new spring board.
Entry.233:
Morning easy, but wagon required at the hut in the afternoon. Laid line D8 two pairs one for each wagon. Pip Page. from near Div to Bde. Returned at great pace & a wheel came off.

Home late in evening.
Entry.234:
Things as usual – busy cleaning saddlery – 

Called out about 7 p.m. with wagon – Two wagons mine – Chancellors. Up along main road & a fair way up one of the wheels of my wagon stuck – Could not repair. Shelled rather heavily. Horses withdrawn. Finally removed wagon to side of the road & took stores on cable card. Laid line. 10th Bde – 291 QFA.
Entry.235:
Mr Cook did not turn up so as place shelled began line without proper direction. Nearly finished when I met Mr Cook. Finished all right – began to return home. Met Chanc. wagon. Returned together as relieving the congestion of 3 chaps to the cart. Home about 1.30 am. 

Up at 6 am advised Sergt of wagon abandoned. Away about 8.15 a.m. with limber, 4 horses. Found screw washer had loosened and had tightened on wheel jamming it. Returned after repairing. 

Afternoon spent completing repairs wagon. Running through cable at night very busy & tired.

Monday 26 August

Up as usual but suddenly advised 8 am. that we were moving immediately. 

Packed & moved out in no time via Sailly-le-Sec – Laurete, Chipilly to Etinehem. One Detachment left 
at
 behind. 

Pulled into Div H.Q. three wagons ordered immediately. Was able to have dinner first. Ran line from 11 Bde to 10 Bde roads harassingly shelled so had to try a different route. Got to 10th alright at Rly Stn Bray. Line not O.K. Returned to
Entry.236:
repaired incorrect joint. 

Home to horselines on Chipilly Rd. Well tired. Got knocked on back of knucles only scratched.
Entry.237:
Put wagon in order & knocked about getting stores etc.

Afternoon out to Chipplly Ex., SAA, MDS, Div Train. Run out of cable 400 yds from Div Train. Returned Chipplly but could not obtain cable. Returned about 9 p.m.

Tired once more.

Wednesday 28 August

 back to finish Div Train line. Fixed up many matters and stood by. 

Ordered out immediately about 5 pm just before tea. Out to 251 Bde R.F.A then to 10th Bde then to
Entry.238:
A.F.A. & finally to Bray. Last section in pitch dark. Very hard.

Home about 12.30 a.m. Lines working well. Shelling heavy.
Entry.239:
Had tea on arrival home. Slept in until about 10.30 am breakfast being brought into the tent. Had an easy morning.

Move ordered immediately after dinner for 2 pm. Move via Bray, Cappy to Suzanne & camped near Chateau. Made ourselves comfortable.

Then I went in box car to Curlu to take cable forward to Page. Shelling heavy. Great ride.
Entry.240:
Things easy in morning & early afternoon. 

Then suddenly ordered to move immediately to Curlu 2 Det. & 1 cablecart. Moved out before tea & made ourselves comfy.

Obtained accommodation in dugout.
Entry.241:
Wet in morning. Nothing much doing so watched prisoners & wounded coming in at Ambulance – very busy, & interesting. Saw several burials. 

Afternoon finer. Writing in afternoon. 

Prussian Guards (volunteered to stop us) amongst prisoners.
Entry.242:
Still in same position. Things very easy – writing & looking about chiefly. 

Afternoon suddenly recalled to Suzanne. Arrived, fixed up, busied
 Knocking about all the afternoon. Plenty of writing.
Entry.243:
Things easy – Afternoon suddenly recalled to Suzanne. So packed up & off. 

Arrived, fixed tent, cleaned busied to show opposite D.HQ. Saw Press Representatives, German Prisoners goose-stepped past HQ. Visited vault desecrated by Fritz.

Then to Cooees 7.30. Prisoners Pioneers busy all day on building.
Entry.244: Cleaning up all day. Evening to write but Hoppy arrived so visited Cooees with him. Home late again. Hoppy doing well.
Entry.245:
Cleaning up though warned about very rapid work. Congratulated etc by Capt Buckland on work. 

Called out about 3 p.m. To Curlu laid line to Clery then to Ommiecourt les Clery. To lay another to 10th Bde but wagon missed me. 

So home about 10.30. Camp swamped by rain.
Entry.246:
Up early & moved off to Clery – raised to the ground – again with all gear. Fixed up & took things easy.

Managed a bit of writing later.
Entry.247:
Things easy for a while then moved off immediately to past Peronne which is knocked about thoroughly. Then ordered out on 11th Bde line to Tincourt. Went well until cable ran out.

Waited about for cable to arrive. Officers "forgot" it. Harrassingly shelled. Rough time. Finally cable arrived. Commenced work but shelling put us to flight. Henderson severely knocked. 

Finally finished line returned home. Put up camp.
Entry.248:
Went out to the scene of yesterdays operations & found Milligans tunic. Picked up Hendersons plyers & knife. Henderson not too good according to reports. 
Returned
 Took private gear to Major. 

Ordered back to Clery scrounging cable. Returned via Peronne. Made camp at old lines. Pleasant supper & to peace peacefully.
Entry.249:
Up & out 9-30 to reel in cable. To Curlu to 74 Div. 2 ½ reels. Afternoon Div to 51 Bde. Only ½ drum left. Then returned to camp.

Evening talking etc.
Entry.250:
Out all day from Div. to J18. Had lunch on Mount St Quentin. Reeled up 10 miles & returned home via Div. Dropped cable there. Up in evening getting orders until very late. 

Wet & rainy.
Entry.251:
Out again to Curlu to Vaux. Got 5 drums D8. Returned home. Other portion of camp removed up to Doingt.

Wet again. To rest tomorrow.
Entry.252:
Rested all day & had peaceful time.

Up to main road to ring up at night but had to climb pole & then could not locate line. Returned home without reporting.
Entry.253: All again as per usual. Reeled up two D8S from Susanne to Vaux Wood. Fine day for a pleasant change wrote at night.
Entry.254: Out reeling in 2D8s from Vaux Wood towards Curlu. Reached Curlu village. Writing afternoon.
Entry.255:
Out again with 4 horses. going into Div. to change his. Reeled up from Clery to Curlu. Then remainder of the two pair to Curlu.

Afternoon 
was
 bath & waiting up at road for W Sims. 

Evening writing.
Entry.256:
No drums so slept in late. Awakened by Mr Sims coming to pay us before we went out to work. What! To clean wagon today return tomorrow. Visited Div for tomorrows breakfast. Cleaned wagons. 

Finished mail. Good day.
Entry.257:
Moved off with whole show to Div. H.Q. Arrived well before dinner & settled down. Came by Peronne. 

Everything well. Evening to Doingt to p.m.
Entry.258: At the old routine again. To bath in afternoon in Peronne. Evening knocking about CCS. Successful stunt during the day.
Entry.259: Wagons saddlery looked after. Evening to Blue Gums. Not too good.
Entry.260: Fooled around all day, chiefly returning horses on to their correct grazing ground with Paddy the dog. Evening walk to Doingt. Saw train load of tank.
Entry.261:
Morning as usual. Afternoon 11th Bde sports close handy. Attended & enjoyed the fun. Good afternoon.

Evening – the whole tent visited the Cooees at Doingt. Had good time. Supper & then to bed.
Entry.262: Afternoon played football against 11 Bde. Rained, cold wind so not too pleasant. Lost the match by 14 points. To bed early.
Entry.263:
Morning usual after discussion re detachment personnel. Lost Stradling – acquired Taylor T.

Evening to Cooees. Good – Condensed. Silver King rendered. Very fine. Home to supper to bed.
Entry.264: Just the same all day. Evening walked to Doingt for papers. Returned with 3 papers & found the tent already full of them.
Entry.265:
Very quiet & easy all day.

Evening walked to Peronne & around about. Very interesting.
Entry.266:
Things just as usual. Visited the Cooees in evening. 

Boring for water & expect to go 200 ft.

Fair day.
Entry.267:
Things just much the same until after dinner. Ordered forward. 

Moved off about 2 pm to Roisel. Road on the way Shelled but we were OK. Camped in a valley but ordered out on job in darkness. From to main route.
Entry.268:
Chaps breakfasted in bed. Things at ease in morning. 

Out to 27th American Div, 9th Bde, 10 Bde. Some trouble with horses in front of heavy guns. Line was laid right beneath the muzzles. 

Peaceful night after visit of a Fritz plane with bombs (very low).
Entry.269:
Called up at 2.30 a.m. & packed tent & moved out to Templaux then quite close to front line. Arrived Templaux, unpacked wagon, fed horses in wagon, barrage started 5.25 a.m. Then moved out to lay a line to Bony. 

Got going well when tanks were observed only a few yards ahead. Stopped, ascertained situation & had to wait until advance recontinued. Moved forward after seeing a tank top the ridge in front. Found 10 Bde had taken position about 1 mile behind their subjective position. 

Moved up with

wagon & laid line to Bde amidst machine gun fire. Had a lucky escape from Mills bomb which exploded 3 yds in front of me. Horse wounded 2 places, King & Maroney got pieces also. Returned to safe place with all hacks but Maroney got a piece shell in the ear, burst a bit in front & he got another piece in the leg. Waited hours & hours for orders to go forward again but finally ordered home about 5 p.m. Nothing to eat (no breakfast) until 4 p.m. 

Advance not too good today mainly on account of Yanks not mopping up & Fritz working through tunnels not mopped up. Hard luck. Wagon did very good – getting very far forward. My horse Maroney evacuated. King back to Roisel for a rest. Camp prepared by Chancellor.
Entry.270:
Cold day – 
Up & walked horse
 Had horses fed & watered as possible during the day. No trips. Living in a tent 7 of us abreast in a 10 yds space.
Entry.271:
Walked horses about – fed & watered.

After dinner ordered out with full gear. Packed up & with Mr Fountain moved out to 10th Bde again. Still pretty rough, took shelter behind a tank. After waiting about 1 hour, further work found impracticible. Returned home none too sorry.
Entry.272:
Morning easy

Morning out to try to get Bony at last. Got the wagon to 10th Bde then along road to near junction road & Bony. Pulled cable up the hill to 11 Bde leaving wagon in cutting. Heavy harrassing fire. Finally finished & returned via Hargicourt.

Afternoon easy.
Entry.273: Packed up & returned to Doingt. Very glad indeed to be relieved. Feeling tired etc. Fixed up cover in same position. Feeling very comfortable after the work.
Entry.274:
Cleaned wagons. Walked Doingt, reserved seats for Cooees. 

Camp declared "closed" after work. However got permission for leave visit show. O.K. 

Rumours of move back tomorrow.
Entry.275:
Up & preparing for move off. Packed up & ready to move early but 
delay
 to wait. Finally had dinner & moved off 12.30.

Moved to near Halle & had to wait for 9th Bde transport. Detailed for billeting party so rode forward with officer 6 others to Marcourt. Division of transport on rode. 

Very longer. Fixed up gully at Marcourt. Colum arrived about 9-30.
Entry.276: Away again on billeting. Left Marcourt & arrived Saint Saveun. No accommodation, so went to Argreuves. Fixed up & column arrived about 5 pm. Passed through Amiens visited Cathedral.
Entry.277: With column from Argreuves to Hallencourt. Arrived after little rain about 5 p.m. Fixed up & slept under wagons. Arranged private mess. Horses in stables.
Entry.278:
Up & at things as usual. Get things fixed up. Obtained a billet for the lot in afternoon.

Wet.
Entry.279: Commenced mess. Good. Things quiet. Rather windy & cold.
Entry.280: Things very easy. Wintry weather. Piano obtained in big billet. Acquired a billet with Jack Ferguson. Not too bad. Singing up in big billet during evening.
Entry.281: Still wintry day. Knocked about. Fergy pretty crook. Taken in hand by the Madame. Very kind & attentive. Writing heavily.
Entry.282: Things good & easy. Lodged cable home "Splendid". Easy again today though weather wintry.
Entry.283: Up with a bad headache. Carried on as usual but after a route march visited Carroll who consigned me to bed. Had Madame looking after me. Influenza.
Entry.284: Feeling relieved toward morning but failed to improve. Remained in bed all day. Madame very kind. Got some additional medicine in evening. Carroll being away all day.
Entry.285: Not too good but got up a bit & sat near the fire. In bed early in afternoon.
Entry.286: Got a dose of salts & felt a bit better. Evening went round to the Mess for tea after being paid. Very cold for me.
Entry.287: Had breakfast in bed but dinner & tea at the mess. Much better, but need to be very careful of the cold.
Entry.288: Breakfast in bed in again & round to mess for dinner & tea. Pleasant day – had a couple of walks about. In next door in evening.
Entry.289:
On duty again so up at 6 am as usual. Things much the same as old.

Visited Longpre to enquire 
to
 re I.O.M. but it had moved to Hallencourt. Had pleasant ride with Shonner.
Entry.290: On duty again but spent a pleasant easy day reading "The Scapegoat". Read so persistently that I finished at about 7.30 & then wrote home.
Entry.291:
Muster parade with sickening B.S. Afterwards lot of chaps went off to Abbeville. Very easy indeed. 

In evening to concert with Cooees orchestra Lena Ashly party. Good.
Entry.292:
Took wagon around to I.O.M. where it was condemned. So in afternoon took it to Longpre accompanied by Sid Monk. Got rid of wagon O.K.

During return fixed up to have the new dark Horse. Took it over on return.
Entry.293:
Brushed up the horse & named him temporarily "Toby". Things very easy.

A night trip undertaken with much & little success. Finished up with a feed of fried potatoes very late.
Entry.294: Grooming etc during the morning. Afternoon free except for the parade. Evening reading calling in at recreation room later.
Entry.295: Just hanging about all the morning. Afternoon reading. Evening again.
Entry.296: Day as usual except a little exercise & grazing in afternoon. Applied myself well to a little study in evening. Billet very comfortable.
Entry.297: Route march after parade, then on church parade Major Gault. After that issue of paybooks & blanket. Football in afternoon & writing at night.
Entry.298:
Very fine day. 

As usual in morning Major inspected the crowd. 

Afternoon journeyed to & saw Geoff Stillman. Then to Marieul saw Bill Morgan & Korah Wills. Had tea with Bill & a long yarn with Korah.

Came home in the dark but managed well.
Entry.299: Another fine day. Morning grooming & exercising. Afternoon yarning with the people inside. Evening singsong & easy.
Entry.300: Detailed to be I/C limber on Transport Competition. Made preliminary arrangements. Bath afternoon. Evening visited Den. Wet slightly.
Entry.301:
Commenced cleaning wagon after erecting shelter. Trouble about on horseback so Rough time predicted for the troops. 

Evening writing & yarning next door.
Entry.302:
Cleaning wagons in morning. Afternoon knocking about. Busy with . Evening to Cooees. Very enjoyable & amusing. 

News very good & men in great glee. Talked at mess until late.
Entry.303: On the wagons. Afternoon in luxurious ease on the bed with books. Evening to Cooee Orchestral Concert. Very good solid music.
Entry.304:
On the wagons again. No paint in spite of "magnificent" promises. Reported Major & go things moving otherwise. 

Afternoon football practice in togs. Good. Evening to be pretty early.
Entry.305: Paint arrived so got to work about 10.30. Finished in early afternoon after hard work. Afterwards took things easy. Competition on Thursday. To Pictures YMCA in evening. Very poor.
Entry.306: Fixed wagon up all ready in morning. Football for afternoon postponed about noon. Raining all day. Bath at baths in afternoon. Competition tomorrow postponed. Very miserable day so in evening sat reading in kitchen.
Entry.307:
Tinkered about wagon. Arranged for for stable. Fixed up a few matters. Afternoon at ease.

Evening again to pictures (fair) then to the farm, then in kitchen & finally read on until 12-30 a.m.
Entry.308: On horses etc in morning. Afternoon any how. Evening writing etc. Very easy.
Entry.309:
Morning completed wagon etc. 

Afternoon football V 35 Bn. Won by 28 goals to 2 points after a bad game. Bath. 

Evening 
took
 buzzing 
things easy
 re show tomorrow. Heard of Shonan’s death.
Entry.310: To show. Togged about pretty well. Did not get a place. Maltese got third. Afternoon remained at home, read, & wrote. Evening Cooees. A bit flat.
Entry.311:
Work as usual
 Word communicated that armistice signed. Therefore no work doing. Excitement great.

Afternoon to Abbeville to bury Shonan. Madame made boquet of flowers. After wait at hospital march behind Shonan through the happy streets to cemetry. Ted Briggs, Ted Bennar also dead. 

Evening at farm.
Entry.312: To customary duty again. Things very easy. Evening to pictures. Very poor. Madame away at tea time so we cooked up a great feed.
Entry.313: Paid. Sports in afternoon. Nothing very exciting. Put in most of the evening at the mess.
Entry.314: Weather getting very cold lately. Work as usual. Goldsmith reported dead.
Entry.315:
Obtained passes for , Richy’s & Joe to go into Abbeville by bike. Got in about 12 noon. Had a great time until about 8 p.m. Returned in moonlight. Pretty cold.

Visited mess on arrival. Got to bed late. Had a glorious day.
Entry.316: Still fine but cold. Withdrawn from football competition. Very angry. Exercise afternoon. Evening at Bandicotts who narrowly escaped being counted out. Then to Blue Bird.
Entry.317: Cold – freezing. Just knocking about. Got fire going in afternoon & wrote.
Entry.318:
Girls went to Paris today. 

Day very fine. Nothing much doing. Covering 
chaps
 hard at work.
Entry.319: Very quiet. Fine but very cold. evening after witnessing chaps dancing.
Entry.320: Very misty. Things much the same. Football controversy in afternoon. Knocked about. Evening Lena Ashly’s party. Very good.
Entry.321: Ordinary in morning. Afternoon ride out past . Evening had bucks dance in the hall & had a go.
Entry.322: Things just the same all day. Writing in evening.
Entry.323:
Lieut Howie on stables. 

Phillips returned from hospital & told us of Frank Maroney being in Abbeville. With Mac, O’Brien visited Abbeville. Dug Frank up & had pleasant afternoon & evening. Home very late & hungry. Attached bull on return.
Entry.324: Things as usual. Afternoon attempted to write but was continually frustrated. Bucks dance in evening & afterwards to Blue Bird. Frank rejoined us. Slater posted to
Entry.325:
Wet day.

Afternoon visited Abbeville by boxcar fixing up for dances. Evening to concert in hall – "Dramatic". Very rough. Afterwards yarning inside & writing.
Entry.326:
Managed a new pair breeches for dance. Afternoon cleaning up after bath. Left Hallencourt about 5.15 p.m. & arrived Abbeville just a bit late. 

Waac
 Dance in Y.W.C.A. at No. 3 Camp. Plenty of Waacs. Had one dance (miserable failure. Afterwards looked after refreshments. Very successful evening.
Entry.327:
Wet dismal day. Knocking about. In evening "silent" visit to Abbeville in box car with Mac, King, Frank & Joe. Visited Cooees. After reaching home great fun.

Still wet. Fooling around. Received parcel. Rested evening.
Entry.328: Morning as usual. Afternoon out on horse & saw football. 38 V Pioneers. Interesting match.
Entry.329: Orderly corporal under new regime. Church parade in hall. Afternoon writing. Evening card party in bedroom.
Entry.330: Trying to get into Abbeville but failed. Evening Pictures. Cards again.
Entry.331: Leave parted to Abbeville but lorry did not turn up. Waited about all the morning. Afternoon training football in Gendarmie with medicine ball. Evening writing & amusement.
Entry.332: Instructed to be ready for transfer to Horseferry Rd today or tomorrow. Application for 3 days leave rendered unnecessary. Fussed about all the morning arranging for photo of the boys. Taken about 12.30. Packing up in afternoon. Evening had the boys home & made a bit of fun for a goodbye.
Entry.333:
Flew about fixing up pass etc until 10.30 when I hurriedly left the old boys in the box car. 

Arrived Abbeville R.S. & caught civilian train to Boulogne arriving there about 2.30 p.m. Had dinner booked a bed at the Grand Louvre. Strolled about in afternoon visited the pictures & after more strolling finished up with a dinner.

Got to bed about 10 pm but slept a restless night.
Entry.334:
Up at 7 & after breakfast down to the wharf. In spite of great scheming could not travel on morning boat. 

So knocked about the town instead. After dinner visited the wharf & finally got aboard & said goodbye to France. Arrived Folkstone & then London all right. Dug up Will, & Bert & put the night up with him.
Entry.335: Into town early & got paid, fixed up with clothing & interview Education Bn. Afternoon touring Albert Halls heard Clara Butt & Evening to a Cantata given at a church by some friends of Wills & put in a pleasant social evening afterwards at Floyds.
Entry.336: Into Westminster Wes. Church for morning service. Then visited Australia House & Queens Hall Concert. Church & a visit to Wills friends again.
Entry.337: Into town & interviewed re leave. Got 14 days from tomorrow. Hurried about all day fixing things up. Had a good look at Australia House searching for information. Left for Glasgow 11.30 pm.
Entry.338:
Arrived 9.30 Glasgow after good trip. 
Stop
 Booked at Argyle Hotel. Knocked about all day. Visited Cummings in evening had a good evening.
Entry.339: Moved to Grand Hotel. Visited Art Galleries in morning & in afternoon. Weather not too good but fairly enjoyable. Evening met the two Cummings & went to Fergusons for the evening. Enjoyable also.
Entry.340:
Met Bob Patterson at breakfast & knocked about in morning. Afternoon visited Pictures & evening to Theatre Betty at Bay 
with
 Walked "home" & finally left about 1.30 a.m. Home to bed just on two.
Entry.341: Met Bob Patterson at breakfast then a couple of his friends. Visited Art Galleries again. Caught 4.15 pm train to Stranraer for Belfast. Arrived about 9 p.m. Tea & then a stroll around in the moonlight.
Entry.342: Up at 6 a.m. & after breakfast caught boat to Larne. Train then to Belfast 11a.m. Went through city in jaunting car with a chap I had met. Afternoon went out for a tram ride & during evening knocked about with a couple of friends.
Entry.343: After two unsuccessful endeavours visited Harland & Wolffs. 12 ships under construction 18,000 tons the largest. Wet. Train ride. Then in evening to Laws. Played cards, yarned & suffered twice until 3.10 am.
Entry.344: Not up until near 11 a.m. Visited Allisons & arranged trip to Bangor. Left Belfast for Bangor 12.55 with Law. Visited friends Bangor. Pleasant music & stroll about. Finally caught in bad rain & train 10 p.m. & taxi home to Adelaide. Home early myself.
Entry.345: Left Belfast – arrived Dublin 1.30. Walked about called on Mr. Malcolm & visited place in evening. Nice evening very quiet.
Entry.346: Round Guinnesses brewery in morning. Lunch with Mr. Malcolm at St Andrews. Afternoon Museum. Evening Malcolms singing with Mrs. Dickenson.
Entry.347: Met first thing by Mrs. Dickenson George. Visited Phoenix Park then dined then to Kingstown. Afterwards to Malcolms singing & cards.
Entry.348:
Breakfast in bed but up 9.30 a.m. Met Miss Cumming at church & slightly late owing to Irish time being 20 min slow. Snowing. 

To Cummings for dinner. Then to Wesleyan Bible Class Musical afternoon. Tea at Fergusons. Home in hurry. Goodbye to Cummings very hurriedly. Caught special tram home.
Entry.349:
Called on
 Visited Cathedral in morning. Afternoon to pictures. Then visited out near Botanic Gardens. Had tea & caught the 9 pm train to London. Spent last 1/- on pillow & arrived London with 6 1/2d.
Entry.350:
Arrived London 7 a.m. Out to Buxton. Had breakfast. Got some money. Visited town with Bert. Home & cleaned up in afternoon. 

Caught 4.53 pm to Sutton as guest of a Mrs. C.H. Benmore. Nice place & turned in at Sutton after quiet evening.
Entry.351: Up about 10.30 then walked about with "Billy" to Epsom course. Afternoon lazed in drawing room. Evening Christmas Party after Christmas Dinner. Turkey Plum Pudding. Played games sang charades & etc. until early hours.
Entry.352:
Up late again. 
Walked
 Trained to Box Hill walked about the hills. The train to Wimbeldon. Lazed afternoon. Christmas Dinner & Party in evening. Slept at Amos place late.
Entry.353:
Up about 7.45, breakfast at

Left early & got into town about 9.30. Started work at Records. Got rigged out. Evening out Hampstead & had a rollicking evening. 

Wrights.
Entry.354:
Work 
as usual
 again at Records. O’Brien, Bodsworth & Schofield arrived. Afternoon knocking about. Evening writing & talking.
Entry.355: In morning moved to digs in Charlwood Place near Victoria. Afternoon with boys around Hampstead Heath & Golders Green. Evening to Church & then to Floyds. Home late.
Entry.356:
Work as usual all day.

Evening to Floyds to practice singing. Then to Guys Hospital. Saw the Old Year go. Bonfires etc. Rather quiet tho worked hard for fun.
